positions.rationale: Monster earnings beat being ignored — reversion opportunity. Q4 EPS $3.81 vs $3.05 expected (+25%), fastest revenue growth in 2 years (+12% YoY), $50B buyback announced, Agentforce at $800M ARR with 29,000 deals. Stock was -28% YTD pre-earnings despite best print in enterprise software history. Market overly punishing AI disruption fears ("SaaSpocalypse") — a $50B buyback at these prices is enormous. Coiled spring setup.

Fresh earnings beat + defensive rotation tailwind. EPS $2.38 vs $2.27, revenue +7% to $2.34B, FCF $487M vs $151M YoY. Coffee segment (Folgers, Café Bustelo, Dunkin') up 23%. Stock-specific move — peers MKC, HRL, CPB all down on the same day. Elliott Management activist pressure adding catalyst. Broke above $109–111 resistance on heavy volume. Day 1 of post-earnings move, not a chase.

Deeply oversold mean-reversion with near-term catalysts. Down ~37% over past year, trading at just 8x forward earnings. Bloomberg reported Stripe acquisition rumours. New CEO Enrique Lores starts March 1. Potential double-bottom forming, RSI severely oversold. Analyst consensus target $64 (+36% upside). High-risk speculative position — entered only after stock held above $44 confirmation level.
